alert.note: Alert for Hickman (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 6:57PM CST until March 01 at 7:48AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River At Centerville affecting Hickman County. For the Duck River...including Centerville...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Duck River At Centerville. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, All areas along the Duck River near Centerville will be covered by flood waters. Defeated Creek, Bears Creek, Swan Creek, Lowes Bend, and Horse Branch Creek will be flooded due to backwater. Many roads near the river will be impassable due to high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CST Thursday the stage was 30.2 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 PM CST Thursday was 30.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 32.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 32.1 feet on 03/22/1955. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 100 PM CST.
